title: Price to Free Cash Flow???
text:
Not a lot of financial metrics, unless they are negative, are useful all by themselves.

Finviz.com has a free stock screener where you can see Price to FCF (ttm) . I would agree that FCF is more important than cash flow. FCF is what is left to pay dividends, buy back stock, make an acquisition, pay down debt.

Seeing FCF by itself stated in dollars allows me to see how safe a dividend is for instance. If $500M a year is being paid in dividends, and $500M a year is being generated each year in FCF, a red flag goes up for me as there is no money left internally to do anything else. I also like to look at it over time or during a specific time (say during the last recession), to gauge whether a company can whether a storm if and when an economic down turn will happen.

Everyone is different, but that is how I used FCF.
